p.s: I wanted to tell you about a thought of mine.
I actually found an old speech of Boris Johnson in 2021, do you remember the speech?
Because I actually did.
I remember that when the speech was in the TV that I watched it and one specific line stuck with me.
He says taht the unborn children would be even more angry at the leaders of 2021 if they would fail to stop climate change.
Then he says that they would have had the technology, the ideas , the corporations and the NGOs.
What do you think about this?
I mean, I do admire his spirit and compasion, but we all nowknow what happened.
And I mean ... he was right.
We are mad.
Our children are mad.
I remember when I told Josie my daughter about how we had snow in winter, she could not imagine it.
And then she threw a tandrumtantrum because she wanted to see it, she even wanted to build a snowman.
We build a snowman out of clay afterwards to make it up to her that we ruined the planet.
I think if she gets older she will not be satisfied with a clay snowman anymore, when she realizes the consequences.
We lifelive in the Norden of germanyGermany anand the lowest temperature this year was 30Â°C.
Half the worldsworld's population died, because of the temperature, the new viruses set free from the melted ice in the polar caps and then the tornados, the fires and droughts.
She will be infuriated.
Like me.
So yes, we will be mad.
We are mad, Johnson.
But actually, I am not sure if we really had the ideas, technology etc. like Johnson claimed.
We had ideas yes, I remember when people tried to use solar energy and wind energy instead of colecoal, but the multiorganisations did not wentgo along.
Like the governments.
They made promises but did nothing.
On the other hand, I am not sure if the technology of 2021 was enough to prevent this.
We relied too much on fossil fuels and unsustainable methods.
The people could not have lived back then how we do now.
We live in bunkers in the earth, earn energy only with the sunpower and use every bit of food and goods not we gives us.
The people did not have the right mindsets, they could not reuse a T-Shirt for multiple years, they did not learn how.
So many irrelevant things were important, like having a perfect body, being fashionable and so on.
It's actually hilarious.
Why would it matter to look fashionable, when the world is dying?
The answer is easy, they did not see it.
We understand now, all of us even Josie does and she is only four years old.
The selfishness and profit were totoo important, the capitalism screwed all of them over.
Even me, to be honest.
Do you remember how you behaved back then?
Your thoughts?
I'd love to talk about them, it'd be funny I think.
But back to Johnson, I think he holdheld a fairly decent speech, but no matter how good his speech was he failed.
I would say that he was right, we had the ideas, we may even have had the appropriatappropriate technology, but we did not have the right mindset.
The unsustainable lifestyle and selfishness sat totoo deep.
It is very sad, that that is what killed half of our population and the world.
Especially the world.
But maybe, just maybe have our children the right mindset and maybe they will make it right.
Maybe they can do what we, what they could not.
I do not know.
What do you think?
I'd love to hear your thoughts!
And I am sorry for the depressing letter, but this was on my mind for some time and I needed to share my thoughts.
Greet Will and your little ones.
